intro: Blepharis dichotoma, commonly known as the two-branched beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing pink to purple flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats. Blepharis dichotoma is a perennial herb that is drought-tolerant and adapted to arid environments.
